title: The life and death of the merry deuill of Edmonton With the pleasant prancks of Smug the smith, Sir Iohn, and mine host of the George, about the stealing of venison. By T.B.
author: T. B. (Thomas Brewer)
publisher: Printed by T[homas] P[urfoot?] for Francis Faulkner dwelling ouer against St. Margarets hill in Southwarke,
notes: Not the same work as "The merry devill of Edmonton" (STC 7497), a play with the same imprint.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
